@ggreenwald These are contextual decisions that a court ultimately should make but in absence private businesses and citizens can. Most people believe that there is far more unchecked advocacy for organized violence on Parler than FB/Twitter. They advertise themselves as unregulated!!

@ggreenwald Here I agree with you in not rushing to pass new laws. But the reform I am calling for in terms of having social media companies remove speech plotting and organizing violence on a court order and enforcing those terms of service seem to me reasonable and not a rush to judgment.

@ggreenwald I do think we need reforms of FB and YouTube including consent before gathering data, disclosure of algorithmic amplification, enforcement of standards on inciting violent speech, court orders to remove speech illegal under Brandenburg

@ggreenwald FB does not have clean hands but has terms of service prohibiting speech inciting violence & an oversight board to enforce. Parler has refused to draw that line. I hope they will. I believe we need alternative social media sites ‚Äîjust not ones w/ boundary re violence.

@ggreenwald It applies to any speech that incites imminent violence which is illegal under Brandenburg. I am simply asking that platforms remove illegal speech. And we do need to amend the law so that social media companies remove illegal content on a court order.

@ggreenwald Our jurisprudence has never protected speech used to plan mass killings or speech that is a true threat. Which serious democratic thinker -Mill, Habermas, Rawls, Taylor, anyone else? ‚Äîwould defend speech inciting imminent violence as necessary for democratic deliberation?

@ggreenwald Parler can still be downloaded off the web or through side loading on Google. And they will find an alternative web hosting service. If they commit to take down active plotting of assassinations and armed attacks, then I would stand up to protect their free speech rights.

@ggreenwald We need legal reform to require social media companies to take down speech that is illegal under Brandenburg and incites violence contingent on a court order. Until we have that law, I think tech companies should enforce their terms of service when it comes to violent speech.

@ggreenwald Thread: I have no problem with conservative or right wing speech and stood up for its protection on Hunter Biden emails. But under Brandenburg imminent incitement to violence and planning assassinations are not protected speech.
